history.content: ME 193B is a pretty hard class, despite there being no exams. It requires a fair bit of foreknowledge in dynamics and controls, so watch out (and given that you're taking 120 now, you probably haven't taken 128). I liked it quite a lot though, and def recommend it. I'd definitely plug 106A as a potential prereq/coreq to 193B (193B has a fair bit of material overlap with 106B).

children.subject:
Any controls course would be a reasonable prereq. I think the reason 221A was recommended is because taking it indicates graduate mathematical maturity, which is very good to have for that course. Personally, I think a combo of EE 220B, EECS 106A, and knowledge of state space control / PID would be the ideal prereqs for the class, but you can certainly get by with less.

I personally regret taking 192, but that's more because:

1. I already knew most of the material

2. It's a lot of work even if you know the material

3. I work in the algorithm/control theory side of robotics rather than mechatronics.

I think 192 is actually a pretty great class, and imo is particularly good for somewhat younger students since you learn a little about a lot of different topics.

i see.
Thanks for the precious advice.
How helpful is EE221A for ME 193B? The syllabus wrote that EE 221A was recommended
I also want to take EE 192, would you recommend taking it?
